trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow acolyte has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow acolyte to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow acolyte has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Signature Attack
entries: {@i Rapier}
{@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.
At 7th level, retainers can take two signature attacks per round.

action.name: Bless (3/Day)
entries: {@spell Bless} at 2nd level. {@i Prerequisite: 5th-level retainer, Triss}

action.name: Bane (3/Day)
entries: {@spell Bane} at 2nd level. {@i Prerequisite: 5th-level retainer, Nili}

bonus.name: Bladesong (3/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 3rd-level retainer}
The drow acolyte can use a bonus action to start the Bladesong, which lasts for 1 minute. While its bladesong is active, it gains the following benefits:
- You have advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks.
- You gain a +3 (Wisdom) bonus to any Constitution saving throws you make to maintain concentration on a spell.

bonus.name: Spiritual Weapon (1/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 7th-level retainer}
{@spell Spiritual Weapon} at 4th level (Rapier).
{@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) force damage.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Signature Attack
entries: {@i {@spell Ray of Frost}}
{@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60/60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the sage's next turn.

action.name: Blink (3/Day)
entries: {@spell Blink}. {@i Prerequisite: 5th-level retainer}

action.name: Dimension Door (1/Day)
entries: {@spell Dimension Door}. {@i Prerequisite: 7th-level retainer}

action.name: The Library (1/Day)
entries: {@i Artisan: The Sage}
The sage makes a {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check. On a success choose one of the following advantages:
• You have advantage on your next attack roll against the target.
• You negate one resistance on your next attack
roll against the target.
• The target has disadvantage on its next saving throw against your spells or abilities.
You meaning one allied creature.

bonus.name: Misty Step (3/Day)
entries: {@spell Misty Step}. {@i Prerequisite: 3rd-level retainer}

Tens of thousands of years ago, the elves were divided, with those of benevolent disposition battling those that were selfish and cruel. The war among elvenkind ended when the good elves banished their malevolent kin to the subterranean depths. Here, in the lightless caverns and endless warrens of twisting passages, the dark elves-the drow-found refuge. They also found leadership in the only elven deity who had not forsaken them. At her command, the dark elves built an empire in the underworld.

entries.name: Children of Lolth
entries: The drow worship Lolth, a deity who resides in the Abyss. Known as the Spider Queen or the Demon Queen of Spiders, she is the figure around which the dark elves have built their subterranean civilization. Whatever she demands, the drow do. The wickedest of elves, drow are seldom seen by the surface world. Though they plot to destroy the elves that banished them, they no longer see themselves as exiles. They are the destined rulers of the darkness, and when Lolth commands them to rise up and destroy their surface-dwelling kin, they will.

entries.name: Creatures of Darkness
entries: The drow have lived underground for so long that they have evolved to their surroundings and can see in the dark. However, they can no longer stand sunlight. When slaves are in short supply in the Underdark, the drow send raiding parties to the surface to capture humanoids under cover of darkness, bringing them back to their cities to be tortured into submission. Beyond those occasional excursions, the drow are content to remain in their subterranean realm, where they feel secure and in control.

entries.name: Underdark Cities
entries: The dark elves build fantastic cities in enormous caverns where food and water are abundant. Their ability to sculpt stone rivals that of the greatest dwarf artisans, yet their structures retain a decidedly elven aesthetic. Though appearing delicate, drow settlements are structurally sound and remarkably resilient. The drow like to hollow out enormous stalagmites and stalactites, creating populated spires that rise from the floors and ceilings. A drow city is a sprawling metropolis enclosed by high walls. Non-drow visitors must conduct their business outside the walls under watchful eyes. The drow raise and keep giant spiders to help protect their cities against intruders, even as they drape those cities in beautiful webbing, creating a gossamer snare to catch flying enemies that would otherwise soar over the walls.

entries.name: Drow Magic
entries: Just as the drow have adapted to underground life, so too has their magic. In addition to using that magic to carve their cities from stone, they empower their weapons, create dangerous new magic items, and summon demons from the Abyss. Drow spellcasters are supremely arrogant and never hesitate to use their magic in the most abhorrent ways.

entries.name: Arms and Armor
entries: Drow craft weapons made of adamantine, a dark and supernaturally hard metal. Drow artisans adorn their weapons and armor with web-like filigree and spider motifs, and mages sometimes imbue items with magic to enhance their effectiveness. However, such magic fades when exposed to sunlight, so that magical drow weapons and armor rarely retain their enhancement bonuses and magical properties when brought to the surface.

entries.name: Cutthroat Politics
entries: Drow politics are cutthroat and rife with intrigue. When drow work together, it is typically to destroy a common foe and ensure their own survival, and such alliances are short lived and fraught with peril.

Drow society is divided into noble houses, each ruled by a matron who seeks to raise the prestige and power of her house above all others. Other high-ranking members of the house are blood relatives, while the middling ranks are flush with drow from weaker families that have sworn fealty to the greater house. Clinging precariously to the bottom rung of a house's social ladder are the house slaves, made up of drow of low birth and the occasional non-drow captive.

entries.name: Matriarchal Rule
entries: Lolth, through her faithful priestesses, dictates the rules of drow society, ensuring that her orders and plots are carried out. Since Lolth is prone to manifesting on the Material Plane and directly punishing those that disobey her, the drow have learned to heed what she says and do as her priestesses command.

In drow society, males are subservient to females. A male drow might lead an Underdark patrol or a raiding party to the surface, but he reports to a female drow-either the matron of his house or one of her hand-picked female subordinates. Although male drow can fill almost any function in drow society, they can't be priests, nor can they rule a house.

entries.name: Poison Predilection
entries: Distilled from spider venom and the flora of the Underdark, poison can be found in abundance among the drow, and it plays an important part in their culture and politics. Drow mages concoct a viscid toxin that leaves enemies {@condition unconscious}. Drow warriors coat their blades and crossbow bolts with this venom, looking forward to the interrogation and torture that follows combat.

entries.name: Variant: Drow Magic Armor and Weapons
entries: Drow often wear magic armor and carry magic weapons that lose their enhancement bonuses permanently if they are exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

items: A drow wearing a +1 chain shirt and carrying a +1 shortsword has AC 16 and a +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls with shortsword attacks.
A drow elite warrior wearing +2 studded leather and carrying a +2 shortsword has AC 20 and a +2 bonus on attack and damage rolls with shortsword attacks.
A drow priestess of Lolth wearing +3 scale mail has AC 19.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the goat moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target it starts charging.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The goat has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Mounted
entries: During a long rest, the goat can designate one creature that rode it within the last 10 days as its rider. The goat gains temporary hit points equal to 4 times the rider’s level or challenge rating after completing the long rest. The goat uses its rider’s proficiency bonus in place of its own proficiency bonus for AC, ability checks, attack rolls, saving throws, and the DC made to save against certain action effects.

trait.name: Mountain Breed
entries: The goat ignores difficult terrain and its long and high jump are 30 feet.

action.name: Combat Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 13 ({@damage 4d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if the goat is charging on the same turn. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: High Ground
entries: The goat needs to stand at least 10 feet higher than the target to use this action. The goat sprints down from its higher position, using gravity to gain speed. The target gets knocked {@condition prone} immediately and has to make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Dogfight (3/Day)
entries: The goat attacks with combat ram uses it horns to lock a target into single combat. Until the target succeeds a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw, it can only attack the goat or its rider. The target can make the saving throw at the end of its turns.

trait.name: Mounted
entries: During a long rest, the lizard can designate one creature that rode it within the last 10 days as its rider. The lizard gains temporary hit points equal to 4 times the rider’s level or challenge rating after completing the long rest. The lizard uses its rider’s proficiency bonus in place of its own proficiency bonus for AC, ability checks, attack rolls, saving throws, and the DC made to save against certain action effects.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The lizard can hold its breath for 15 minutes. (A lizard that has this trait also has a swimming speed of 30 feet.)

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Clapping (1/Day)
entries: The lizards rider gains one Lizard Inspiration die, a {@dice d6}. Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes.

reaction.name: Book it! (1/Day)
entries: If it or its rider is hit, the lizard can move up to its speed away from the attacker. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

A giant lizard can be ridden or used as a draft animal. Lizardfolk also keep them as pets, and subterranean giant lizards are used as mounts and pack animals by drow, duergar, and other Underdark dwellers.
Variant: Giant Lizard Traits
Some giant lizards have one or both of the following traits. Hold Breath. The lizard can hold its breath for 15 minutes. (A lizard that has this trait also has a swimming speed of 30 feet.)

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries: The lizard can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the homunculus is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it's {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Force Strike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d4 + 3} force damage.

reaction.name: Channel Magic
entries: The homunculus delivers a spell you cast that has a range of touch. The homunculus must be within 120 feet of you.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: It can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. The hound takes 5 force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Ill Omen
entries: At the start of its turn, the hound automatically knows its target's location. If the target was hidden, it is no longer hidden from the hound.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Honey is a 7th level {@classFeature spellcasting | ranger | phb | 2 | | ranger} ({@optfeature druidic warrior | tce}) and "1st level {@classFeature pact magic | warlock | phb | 1 | | warlock}" with a {@item +1 rod of the pact keeper | | +1 honey comb eye} as a spell casting focus.
She casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Pact Magic
entries: Regain one 1st level spell slot during a short rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Honey makes two attacks with her bees or shortsword.

action.name: Eldritch Bees
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Moon-Touched Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Gathering Swarm (1/Turn)
entries: When honey hits a creature with an attack, choose one:
- The attack's target takes {@damage 1d6} piercing damage from the swarm.
- The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be moved by the swarm up to 15 feet horizontally in a direction of your choice.
- You are moved by the swarm 5 feet horizontally in a direction of your choice.

bonus.name: Hunter's Mark (3/Long Rest and costs spell slot)
entries: Honey marks up to two targets with {@spell hunter's mark} and {@classFeature favored foe |Ranger||1|TCE}: For 1 hour, when honey hits a marked target with an attack, the target takes an addtional {@damage 1d6} damage for each mark.
While marked, honey has advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) or Wisdom (Survival) check you make to find the target(s).
If a target dies before the minute ends, honey can mark a new target as a bonus action.

bonus.name: Healing Spirit (Costs Spell Slot)
entries: Honey casts {@spell healing spirit | xge}.

bonus.name: Misty Step (Costs Spell Slot)
entries: Honey casts {@spell misty step}.

bonus.name: Writhing Tide (3/Long Rest)
entries: Honey gains a flying speed of 30 feet and can hover. This effect lasts for 1 minute.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Raatka is {@feat fey touched | tce}, a {@feat strixhaven initiate | scc | Witherbloom student}, and a 1st level {@classFeature spellcasting | wizard | phb | 1 | | wizard} with a {@item Ruby of the War Mage | xge | magical} {@item +1 longbow} as a spell casting focus.
She casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Action Surge (1/Short Rest)
entries: On Raatka's turn, she can take one additional action.

trait.name: Archery
entries: Raatka's Fighting Style is {@optfeature archery} (already included in attacks).

trait.name: Arcane Recovery (1/Day)
entries: Regain one 1st level spell slot during a short rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Raatka makes two attacks with her longbow. Using arcane shot on any of them.

action.name: +1 Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 150/300 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Ray of Frost
entries: {@i Cantrip}
{@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage. The target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of Raatka's next turn.

action.name: Shocking Grasp
entries: {@i Cantrip}
{@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage. The target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Arcane Shot (3/Short Rest)
entries: When Raatka hits a creature with an arrow, she can choose one of the following arcane arrow effects (arcane shot save {@dc 15}):

action.name: Bursting Arrow
entries: {@i Arcane Arrow}

You imbue your arrow with force energy drawn from the school of evocation. The energy detonates after your attack. Immediately after the arrow hits the creature, the target and all other creatures within 10 feet of it take {@damage 2d6} force damage each.

action.name: Grasping Arrow
entries: {@i Arcane Arrow}

When this arrow strikes its target, conjuration magic creates grasping, poisonous brambles, which wrap around the target. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra {@damage 2d6} poison damage, its speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it takes {@damage 2d6} slashing damage the first time on each turn it moves 1 foot or more without teleporting. The target or any creature that can reach it can use its action to remove the brambles with a successful Strength (Athletics) check against your Arcane Shot save DC. Otherwise, the brambles last for 1 minute or until you use this option again.

action.name: Piercing Arrow
entries: {@i Arcane Arrow, replaces one attack}

You use transmutation magic to give your arrow an ethereal quality. When you use this option, you don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, the arrow shoots forward in a line, which is 1 foot wide and 30 feet long, before disappearing. The arrow passes harmlessly through objects, ignoring cover. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes damage as if it were hit by the arrow, plus an extra {@damage 1d6} piercing damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.

bonus.name: Curving Shot
entries: If Raatka makes an attack roll with an arrow and misses, she can use a bonus action to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 60 feet of the original target.

bonus.name: Second Wind (1/Short Rest)
entries: Raatka regains {@dice 1d10 + 7} hit points.

bonus.name: Misty Step (Costs spell slot)
entries: Raatka casts {@spell misty step}.

reaction.name: Shield (Costs spell slot)
entries: Raatka casts {@spell shield}.

trait.name: Vigilant
entries: The defender can't be surprised.

action.name: Force-Empowered Rend
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + 3} force damage. If the target is Medium or smaller it becomes {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and the defender can use its action to deal {@damage 1d8 + 3} force damage. The defender can grapple only one target at a time.

action.name: Repair (3/Day)
entries: The magical mechanisms inside the defender restore {@dice 2d8 + 3} hit points to itself or to one construct or object within 5 feet of it.

reaction.name: Deflect Attack
entries: The defender imposes disadvantage on the attack roll of one creature it can see that is within 5 feet of it, provided the attack roll is against a creature other than the defender.

trait.name: Retainer
entries: This creature is a Retainer, as described in {@book Strongholds and Followers|SaF|8|Retainers}

action.name: Signature Attack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) slashing damage.
At 7th level, retainers can take two signature attacks per round.

action.name: Gaping Wound (3/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 3rd-level retainer}

The swordmaster makes an attack with their signature attack against an adjacent creature. On a hit, the target starts bleeding, taking 3 ({@dice 1d6}) damage at the start of each of its following turns. At the end of each of its turns, it can make a Constitution save to stop the bleeding.

action.name: Challenge (3/Day, Bonus Action)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 5th-level retainer}

The swordmaster issues a challenge to an adjacent creature. For 1 minute, if that creature attempts to attack a target other than the swordmaster, or attempts to move away from the swordmaster, the swordmaster immediately makes two attacks with their signature attack against that creature, ending the Challenge.

reaction.name: Retaliate (3/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 7th-level retainer}
After being hit by a melee attack, the swordmaster can immediately make three attacks against the attacker with their signature attack.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: Tasbella has advantage on saving throws against poison, and she has resistance against poison damage.

trait.name: Dueling
entries: When Tasbella is wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, she gains a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon. (already included in the attacks)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Tasbella makes two attacks with her battleaxe.

action.name: Battleaxe +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} 11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Burning Hands (1/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 3rd-level retainer}
Tasbella casts {@spell Burning Hands} ({@dc 14}, {@dice 3d6}).

bonus.name: Vicious Mockery (2/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 5th-level retainer}
Tasbella casts {@spell Vicious Mockery} ({@dc 14}, {@dice 2d4}).

bonus.name: Sword Burst (2/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 5th-level retainer}
Tasbella casts {@spell Sword Burst | tce} ({@dc 14}, {@dice 2d6}).

reaction.name: Defensive Stance (2/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 3rd-level retainer}
Tasbella casts {@spell Absorb Elements | xge} or {@spell Shield}.

trait.name: Retainer
entries: This creature is a Retainer, as described in {@book Flee, Mortals! Preview|fmprev|5|Retainers}.

action.name: Signature Attack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.
At 7th level, retainers can take two signature attacks per round.

reaction.name: Cheer (3/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 3rd-level retainer}
After an ally within 60 feet that Vond can see makes an attack, roll a {@dice d6} and add the result to the ally's result.

reaction.name: Bolstering Praise (1/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 5th-level retainer}
After an ally hits an enemy creature, Vond can convert the hit into a critical hit.

reaction.name: Distracting Taunt (3/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 7th-level retainer}
When a creature Vond can see within 60 feet hits his Mentor, Vond can taunt the creature, forcing it to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, its attack automatically misses.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 15}), requiring no material components:

action.name: Lightning Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 120/120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) lightning damage.

action.name: Shocking Grasp
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage. The target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Hold Person (3/Day, concentration)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 3rd-level retainer}
The warlock casts {@spell hold person} (spell save {@dc 15}).

action.name: Elemental Bane (1/Day, concentration)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 7th-level retainer}
The warlock casts {@spell elemental bane | xge} (spell save {@dc 15}, lightning damage).

action.name: Banishment (1/Day, concentration)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 7th-level retainer}
The warlock casts {@spell banishment} (spell save {@dc 15}).

bonus.name: Wire Walk (1/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 5th-level retainer}

Tex can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space that they can see. If they do any creature in a line between their point of origin and the point of arrival must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d10} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
While in an area with electrical wiring, they can travel up to 120 feet this way.

Warlocks of the fiend gain their powers through magical pacts forged with archfiends of the Lower Planes. These warlocks often keep imps or quasits as companions, and they tend toward extremes of behavior: consorting with fiend-worshiping cultists or dedicating their lives to destroying fiendish cults.

trait.name: Retainer
entries: This creature is a Retainer, as described in {@book Flee, Mortals! Preview|fmprev|5|Retainers}.

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against spells and the {@condition charmed}, {@condition paralyzed}, and {@condition poisoned} conditions.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Retainer
entries: This creature is a Retainer, as described in {@book Flee, Mortals! Preview|fmprev|5|Retainers}.

action.name: Signature Attack (Soulblade)
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) force damage, or 18 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) force damage while under the effect of Enlarge or Invisibility.
{@i At 7th level, retainers can take two signature attacks per round.}

action.name: Dagger of the Mind (1/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 7th-level retainer}
Dariggs manifests the {@spell Dagger of the Mind | talentpsionicsopenplaytestround2} power.

bonus.name: Invisibility (1/Short Rest)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 3rd-level retainer}

The duergar magically turns {@condition invisible} for up to 1 hour or until it attacks, it forces a creature to make a saving throw, or its concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

bonus.name: Enlarge (1/Short Rest)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 3rd-level retainer}

For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.
Soulblades are duergar combatants whose mastery of psionics allows them to manifest blades of psychic energy to slice apart their foes.

entries.name: Duergar

entries: Duergar architecture is remarkable for its brutalist grandeur. It is not a style I would use for my towers—I prefer gold, gems, and tracery—but I admire the boldness of dwarven stonework.
The mental power that duergar wield was given to them by illithids. But why would illithids create servants who could turn invisible or grow to ogre size?
Most likely because those servants would excel at herding their masters' other minions. In retrospect, it seems arguable that duergar escaped bondage because their jailers had given them the keys.

Duergar are dwarves of the deep reaches of the Underdark and other sunless realms. Their personalities and abilities have been deeply impacted by their ancestors' captivity and torment by mind flayers; they were infused with powerful psionic abilities but also a profound gloom. In some, this strain of sorrow inspires works of grand but melancholic beauty, while in others, it manifests as rage.

Like many who dwell in the Underdark, duergar must constantly be on guard against the raids and plots of their neighbors. To this end, duergar warriors fulfill a variety of combat roles, often marrying their fury in battle with their psionic abilities or training dangerous Underdark creatures as mounts.

Denigrated by some as joyless, duergar are in fact deeply passionate in all that they do—even if that passion rarely manifests as mirth. They bring an emotional intensity to their lives, whether they're exploring neighboring tunnels, defending their homes, engaging with their families, or crafting bold new works. The bonds of friendship and kinship are strong, though navigating the inevitable outbursts of frustration and despair is not always easy. Similarly, duergar tend to be very community-minded—in the Underdark, all must cooperate to survive.

Among the duergar of the Forgotten Realms, creation is a fiercely passionate process. They tend to favor works that are sturdy and grand, but in a bare, stripped-down fashion that favors geometric forms. The strongholds they design are blocky and stark, and the weapons they forge are blatantly tools of violence. While others may decry their creations as cold and bare of ornamentation to the point of austerity, duergar see them as honoring the materials used and honest about their purpose.

reaction.name: Dwarven Catcher (3/Short Rest)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 5th-level retainer}
As a reaction to his Mentor making a ranged attack with a {@item Dwarven Thrower | burbuldorplayerhandout} Dariggs can catch it and attack the target as well.
{@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

item.name: Amber of Brass (Dormant)
entries: This round amber with rough surface is infused with energy from the plane of fire. It has translucent surface, through which one can see an ever burning magical flame on the inside. If you're a spellcaster, you can use this item as a spellcasting focus.
When you cast a damage-dealing spell using this item as your spellcasting focus, you gain a +1 bonus to one fire damage roll of the spell.

items.name: Awakened
entries: When the amber reaches its awakened state, it gains the following properties:
When you use a Metamagic option on a spell, one target of the spell that you can see catches fire. The burning target takes 2d10 fire damage at the start of its next turn, and then the flames go out.

items.name: Exalted
entries: You gain resistance to fire and lightning damage.
You can, as an action, use it to cast {@spell thunderwave} as a 4th-level spell (save DC 16) without expending a spell slot.

item.name: Dwarven Thrower
entries: If you are a dwarf, this warhammer has the following properties:

This magic weapon has the thrown property with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. When you hit with a ranged attack using this weapon, it deals an extra {@damage 1d8} damage. Immediately after the attack, the weapon flies back to your hand.

item.name: Javelin of Elvenkind
entries: Seldom an elf crafts a ranged weapon as crude as a javelin. But it is not unheard of. These javelins of elvenkind are forged with finesse and honed for the use for dexterity rather than brute stength.
When thrown using dexterity instead of strength, the range of the javelin doubles (already included in range). If thrown with strength the range is equal to that of a normal {@item javelin | phb}.

In previous ages, the javelins of elvenkind were used by elven athletes in competitions. So they are of cultural importance to older generations of elves. The most famous athlete was Ianquinal Sielithin.

item.name: Mace of Sharindlar (Dormant)
entries: This golden mace bears the burning needle of Sharindlar on its hilt.
The mace has 5 charges and regains 1d4+1 expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Spells
entries: While holding it, you can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spell ability modifier:

items: {@spell Lesser Restoration} as a bonus action (2 charges)
{@spell Fireball} with white flames dealing {@b radiant} instead of fire damage centered on yourself, which does {@b no harm} to yourself or your allies (4 charges)

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The mace grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

items.name: Sentience
entries: The mace of sharindlar is a sentient lawful good weapon with an Intelligence of 10, a Wisdom of 16, and a Charisma of 12. It has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet.
The weapon communicates telepathically with its wielder and can speak, read, and understand Dwarvish and Common.

items.name: Personality
entries: The Mace of Sharindlar posses the personality of Tasbella Gálund, a former cleric of Sharindlar and sister to Thoradin Gálund, the hero of light. It was once whielded by Tasbella for a long time. Over time her ideals became ingraved in its very core. After her death, her soul passed on, but a version of her always remains within this mace.

She seeks to protect dwarves against all enemies, especially those creatures of darkness that once enslaved her people. Conflict arises if the wielder fails to protect dwarves, or to destroy those powers of darkness.

items.name: Awakened
entries: When the mace reaches an awakened state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2.
The number of charges of the mace increased to 10 and it regains 1d6+2 charges daily at dawn.

items.name: Spells
entries: The mace can now also cast the following spells:

items.name: Cleansing Flame
entries: Once per day you may use an action to cleanse the battlefield with a pure white flame of radiant energy. Every allied creature within 30 feet of you can remove one of the following conditions: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, or stunned.
When you do so, you may use a bonus action to use your channel divinity.

item.name: Mace of Smithing
entries: On first glance, this mace can easily be mistaken for a hammer and not only because it comes in a leather bond set of smith's tools. However, its head does not have a cubold shape, but a cubic one. Making it more suited to be handled as a mace during a fight.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. The bonus increases to +3 when you use the mace to attack a construct.

When you roll a 20 on an attack roll made with this weapon, the target takes an extra 7 bludgeoning damage, or an extra 14 bludgeoning damage if it's a construct. If a construct has 25 hit points or fewer after taking this damage, it is destroyed.

entries.name: Smith's Tool
entries: This mace acts as {@item Smith's Tools}. When you use it to make an ability check, you gain a +1 bonus. When using the mace in this way, its head takes the shape of the hammer required for the task.

item.name: Pants of Dancing
entries: While wearing these pants, you have advantage on performance checks while dancing.
When you attune to this item you gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Dancing Queen
entries: You are considered proficient in the performance checks made to dance or move elegantly. If you already are proficient in performance, you are considered to have expertise in those checks.

entries.name: Staying Alive
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points, you instead moon walk 5 feet out of the threatened area and drop to 1 hit point instead. Once you use this feature, you can not use it again until the next dawn.
When you attune to the pants, you have a constant urge to dance and can not take the pants off willingly until the attunement ends.
At least once per day, you need to take a short rest, in which you dance. You still gain the benefit of the short rest.

entries.name: Night Fever
entries: To end your attunement to the pants, you have to spend a whole night (8 hours) dancing only taking breaks for alcoholic beverages, bathroom breaks or casual sex. In that night, you can not gain the benefits of a short or long rest. Only once you finally fall uncousious in the morning the pants peal off you, leaving you exposed.

Wearing the pants for an extended period of time can have dire consequences from broken legs, to paraplegia, to death. It varies from wearer to wearer and case to case, but a week is considered the point of no return for most.

item.name: Shadow-Touched Spear
entries: While holding this magical spear you gain {@sense darkvision} out to the range of 30 feet.

When you attune to this magical spear, shadowy ink spreads across your body starting from your hands forming a tattoo. You gain the benefits from an {@item eldritch claw tattoo|tce} ({@bold Magical Strike}, {@bold Eldritch Maul}).

item.name: Shadow-Tainted Spear
entries: While holding this magical spear you gain {@sense darkvision} out to the range of 60 feet.
When you attune to this magical spear, shadowy ink spreads across your body starting from your hands forming a tattoo. You gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Magical Strikes
entries: While the tattoo is on your skin, your unarmed strikes are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming immunity and resistance to nonmagical attacks, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with unarmed strikes.

entries.name: Eldritch Maul
entries: As a bonus action, you can empower the tattoo for 1 minute. For the duration, each of your melee attacks with a weapon or an unarmed strike can reach a target up to 15 feet away from you, as inky tendrils launch toward the target. In addition, your melee attacks deal an extra 1d6 force damage on a hit. Once used, this bonus action can't be used again until the next dawn.

Once you spent some time attuned to the spear, you reach a symbiotic bond with the shadows. During your next long rest, a fist sized pitch black ooze forms from your tattoo and finds the nearest bodily orifice to enter your body. You gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Grim Euphoria
entries: When you hit with a melee attack using this magic spear and reduce the target to 0 hit points, you gain 2d6 temporary hit points.

entries.name: Shadow Drain
entries: On a hit, you can deal an extra 2d10 necrotic damage to the target. When you do so, you take half of the necrotic damage yourself. In addition, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage for 1 hour on any ability check or saving throw that uses Strength or Constitution. The DC of the saving throw is equal to the necrotic damage taken by the target.

entries.name: Acid Breath
entries: As an action, you can exhale acid in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once you use this property, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Symbiotic Nature
entries: The ooze can't be removed from you while you're attuned to it, and you can't voluntarily end your attunement to it.

item.name: Speaking Stone
entries: If you're a gnome, you can touch the stone and use an action to cast the {@spell sending} spell from it. The target is any other speaking stone whose unique sequence of symbols you know. A creature within 5 feet of the stone hears the message as if they were the target.
During a short or long rest, you can inscribe any number of {@item sending stones} with a unique sequence. Once inscribed, they can receive messages from speaking stones.

spell.name: Moon Blade
entries: You weave together threads of moon light to create a sword of solidified light in your hand. This magic sword lasts until the spell ends. It counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. It has {@hit 1} bonus to attack rolls and deals {@damage 2d8 + 1} radiant damage on a hit and has the finesse, light, and thrown properties (range 20/60). When you hit an undead with it, that target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} radiant damage. In addition, when you use the sword to attack a target that is in moon light, you make the attack roll with advantage. The light from the {@spell moonbeam} spell counts as moon light for this.
If you drop the weapon or throw it, it dissipates at the end of the turn. Thereafter, while the spell persists, you can use a bonus action to cause the sword to reappear in your hand.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd- or 4th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 3d8 + 1}. When you cast it using a 5th- or 6th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 4d8 + 2} and the attack roll bonus increases to {@hit 2}. When you cast it using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases to {@dice 5d8 + 3} and the attack roll bonus increases to {@hit 3}.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Moon Path
entries: Choose two points within range. You create a stair or bridge between them. The bridge of glowing white translucent force like a glass strip that is up to 60 feet long and up to 20 feet wide (and able to vary in width over its length). It can climb or descend, twist and turn, and sticks to its endpoints unshakably, even if these endpoints are actually empty air. A moon path needs no supports. It vanishes if the spell ends, or if it has been completely traversed 10 times in any direction.
Creatures walking on the moon path are protected as follows:
- Their abilities and hit points can not be drained.
- They gain half cover (+2 to AC).
- They gain advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}.
- They cannot fall over or off the moon path.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 6th-level spell slot or higher, the length of the path increases by 15 feet for each level above 5th.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)
